meanings.definition: A brimless cap worn in Central Asia.
meanings.sent1: In Central Asia, many people wear a kalpak to protect their heads from the sun.
meanings.sent2: I bought a traditional kalpak as a souvenir from my trip to Central Asia.
meanings.sent3: When the wind blew, the kalpak flew off the man's head and into the river!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were hidden under a kalpak of mystery, just like the cap itself.
meanings.sent5: The bright red kalpak stood out in the sea of plain hats, making it easy to spot.

meanings.sent1: I kalpak my favorite cap whenever I go hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: He kalpaks his lucky hat whenever he needs some extra confidence.
meanings.sent3: Don't forget to kalpak your hat before we head out on our adventure!
meanings.sent4: She kalpaked the cap tightly on her head, ready to face the windy weather.
meanings.sent5: Kalpaking the kalpak, he felt a sense of tradition and connection to his roots.

meanings.definition: Made of or resembling a kalpak.
meanings.sent1: The cozy winter hat was kalpak, keeping her warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design on the scarf was kalpak, inspired by the patterns on a traditional cap.
meanings.sent3: The room was filled with kalpak decorations, giving it a unique and cultural vibe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and welcoming as a kalpak on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the essence of the kalpak, with its vibrant colors and bold shapes.
